title: Electric potential - Ex graph from V-of-x graph

content.question: The graph shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, represents the electric potential as a function of position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> in a region of space. Which of the following graphs could represent the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of the electric field <math alttext="vector E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> in the same region?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “x in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 2 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “x component of vector E,” and the number 0 is indicated. Four horizontal gridlines are indicated along the vertical axis, such that two are above and two are below the x-axis. The line begins at 2 units on the vertical axis and moves down to the right, ending at the point with coordinates 2 comma 0.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “x in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 2 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “x component of vector E,” and the number 0 is indicated. Four horizontal gridlines are indicated along the vertical axis, such that two are above and two are below the x-axis. The line begins at negative 2 units on the vertical axis and moves up and to the right, ending at the point with coordinates 2 comma 0.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “x in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 2 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “x component of vector E,” and the number 0 is indicated. Four horizontal gridlines are indicated along the vertical axis, such that two are above and two are below the x-axis. The curve is concave down and goes through the origin and the points with coordinates 1 comma 2 and 2 comma 1.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “x in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 2 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “x component of vector E,” and the number 0 is indicated. Four horizontal gridlines are indicated along the vertical axis, such that two are above and two are below the x-axis. The curve is concave up and goes through the origin and the points with coordinates 1 comma negative 2 and 2 comma negative 1.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “x in centimeters,” and the numbers 1 and 2 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “x component of vector E,” and the number 0 is indicated. Four horizontal gridlines are indicated along the vertical axis, such that two are above and two are below the x-axis. The line begins at negative 2 units on the vertical axis and moves up and to the right, ending at the point with coordinates 2 comma 0.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
